html: In the Vietnam War, the U.S. military used an herbicide mixture know as Agent Orange, which includes the chemical dioxin. By the end of the war, places where Agent Orange was stored & handled were significantly contaminated, harming local people, water, & wildlife for decades.
text: In the Vietnam War, the U.S. military used an herbicide mixture know as Agent Orange, which includes the chemical dioxin. By the end of the war, places where Agent Orange was stored & handled were significantly contaminated, harming local people, water, & wildlife for decades.

html: Vietnam is still scattered with unexploded ordinance (UXO) from the war, continuing to put lives at risk today. I joined others in Hue to discuss how we can address this issue and safely dispose any remaining UXO.pic.twitter.com/btsYq7mvAp
text: Vietnam is still scattered with unexploded ordinance (UXO) from the war, continuing to put lives at risk today. I joined others in Hue to discuss how we can address this issue and safely dispose any remaining UXO.pic.twitter.com/btsYq7mvAp

html: During a recent congressional delegation trip to Vietnam, I visited the Citadel, a large walled portion of the city of Hue. The Citadel played a significant role in the Battle of Hue, one of the longest battles of the Vietnam War.pic.twitter.com/bwdLNlqWya
text: During a recent congressional delegation trip to Vietnam, I visited the Citadel, a large walled portion of the city of Hue. The Citadel played a significant role in the Battle of Hue, one of the longest battles of the Vietnam War.pic.twitter.com/bwdLNlqWya

html: We're making progress towards an operational Polar Security Cutter to help meet U.S. needs in the Arctic. Today, the Pentagon announced that VT Halter Marine Inc. has been awarded the contract to build the nation’s first new heavy Polar Security Cutter in more than forty years.

html: The #Arctic is a rapidly changing region with some of the most valuable and readily available resources in the world. As the Arctic changes, so should the U.S.’s strategy for addressing issues such as national security, commerce, the environment, and maritime affairs.

html: Today, @SenDanSullivan, @RepDonYoung & I announced that Jason Hoke was appointed by the Sec. of Commerce as the Denali Commission Federal Co-Chair. I look forward to working with him to continue to build on the Denali Commission’s efforts to improve life in our rural communities.
text: Today, @SenDanSullivan, @RepDonYoung & I announced that Jason Hoke was appointed by the Sec. of Commerce as the Denali Commission Federal Co-Chair. I look forward to working with him to continue to build on the Denali Commission’s efforts to improve life in our rural communities.

html: The Denali Commission was started in 1998 & has since supported a range of significant development projects across AK including transportation facilities, clinics & fuel storage. The Commission has also worked to assist communities in AK that are facing severe coastal erosion.

html: That’s when folks in Bethel realized they needed the Prematernal Home, to provide a safe haven in Bethel for expecting mothers from surrounding villages.
text: That’s when folks in Bethel realized they needed the Prematernal Home, to provide a safe haven in Bethel for expecting mothers from surrounding villages.

html: This image serves as a reminder for how the Bethel Prematernal Home came to be. In the 60s, a pregnant woman was found under an overturned boat near the river. The woman had been told to come to Bethel to have her baby to be safe, but she didn’t have any place to stay.pic.twitter.com/qP2SBYoQ73
text: This image serves as a reminder for how the Bethel Prematernal Home came to be. In the 60s, a pregnant woman was found under an overturned boat near the river. html: The reality some pregnant women face in rural Alaska is a lack of maternity care where they live. For many expecting mothers, that’s where the Bethel Prematernal Home comes in. This new facility is a place for women in the Y-K Delta to come four weeks prior to their due date.pic.twitter.com/nmxCTB23PM

html: In Bethel I saw the earliest breakup of the Kuskokwim and now we see the earliest breakup on the Tanana. As Alaskans we appreciate the nice weather coming on after winter but this is too early. html: On April 16, Dr. King wrote his widely published Letter from Birmingham Jail, defending their nonviolent method of protesting racism. The letter is still frequently referenced today to remind us in Dr. King’s own words that, “Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.”pic.twitter.com/ESrmVhT6fv
text: On April 16, Dr. King wrote his widely published Letter from Birmingham Jail, defending their nonviolent method of protesting racism. The letter is still frequently referenced today to remind us in Dr. King’s own words that, “Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.”pic.twitter.com/ESrmVhT6fv

html: While detained, Dr. King was snuck in a newspaper which included a letter penned by 8 local clergymen in response to the civil rights demonstrations, claiming that any social injustices should be addressed in court & not the streets.
text: While detained, Dr. King was snuck in a newspaper which included a letter penned by 8 local clergymen in response to the civil rights demonstrations, claiming that any social injustices should be addressed in court & not the streets.

html: On April 12, 1963, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and other protesters were detained for taking part in the Birmingham Campaign—a series of nonviolent protests and sit-ins aimed at changing the city’s discriminatory hiring laws.
text: On April 12, 1963, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and other protesters were detained for taking part in the Birmingham Campaign—a series of nonviolent protests and sit-ins aimed at changing the city’s discriminatory hiring laws.

html: Forced marriages, violence & poor socioeconomic status are among the tragic obstacles that many women across the globe face in pursuit of an education. This bill aims to help close educational gaps for young girls in primary school & for women pursuing a secondary education.

html: By reinforcing that the states have supremacy when it comes to marijuana regulation, we are eliminating confusion, and more importantly empowering and protecting states’ rights.
text: By reinforcing that the states have supremacy when it comes to marijuana regulation, we are eliminating confusion, and more importantly empowering and protecting states’ rights.

html: It establishes that stringent state marijuana regulatory regimes, like those which exist in Alaska, have supremacy over federal drug control laws. At the same time, it does not impair the effectiveness of federal marijuana prohibitions in states that have elected not to legalize.
text: It establishes that stringent state marijuana regulatory regimes, like those which exist in Alaska, have supremacy over federal drug control laws. At the same time, it does not impair the effectiveness of federal marijuana prohibitions in states that have elected not to legalize.

html: Today during an Interior Approps Subcmte hearing on the FY2020 @EPA budget request @EPAAWheeler announced that they intend to issue a rule in June relaxing air pollution standards for diesel generators in remote areas of AK— significant, long-awaited news for so many Alaskans.pic.twitter.com/TlUEjG0neQ
text: Today during an Interior Approps Subcmte hearing on the FY2020 @EPA budget request @EPAAWheeler announced that they intend to issue a rule in June relaxing air pollution standards for diesel generators in remote areas of AK— significant, long-awaited news for so many Alaskans.pic.twitter.com/TlUEjG0neQ

html: Over 200 remote communities & villages in Alaska rely on diesel generators for local power & heating but due to Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) regulations that are currently in place, these communities face incredibly high compliance costs to keep those generators running.
text: Over 200 remote communities & villages in Alaska rely on diesel generators for local power & heating but due to Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) regulations that are currently in place, these communities face incredibly high compliance costs to keep those generators running.

html: I appreciate the work @EPAAWheeler has done on returning the EPA to a back-to-basics management approach, ensuring the agency shifts its focus from a one-size-fits-all regulatory agenda back to prioritizing programs w/ actual on-the-ground cleanup & real environmental benefits.pic.twitter.com/kYruSv5Oz5
text: I appreciate the work @EPAAWheeler has done on returning the EPA to a back-to-basics management approach, ensuring the agency shifts its focus from a one-size-fits-all regulatory agenda back to prioritizing programs w/ actual on-the-ground cleanup & real environmental benefits.pic.twitter.com/kYruSv5Oz5

html: From restoring contaminated sites to ensuring clean drinking water, the EPA impacts the lives of Alaskans & all Americans by improving the health of our communities. html: Today’s U.S. Supreme Court ruling in the Sturgeon case is a victory for all Alaskans. The Supreme Court ruled unanimously in favor of John Sturgeon, holding that the Natl. Park Service cannot regulate hovercraft use on the Nation River and didn't disturb the Katie John decisions.
text: Today’s U.S. Supreme Court ruling in the Sturgeon case is a victory for all Alaskans. The Supreme Court ruled unanimously in favor of John Sturgeon, holding that the Natl. Park Service cannot regulate hovercraft use on the Nation River and didn't disturb the Katie John decisions.

html: Alaskans are being impacted by PFAS issues. I've cosponsored legislation to require the EPA to list these compounds as hazardous substances, supported an amendment to allow airports to purchase non-fluorinated firefighting foam, and now I’m proud to lead on this bipartisan bill.

html: Rather than encouraging individuals and small business to use our lands, federal bureaucracy and a lack of resources and capacity are making it difficult to provide a quality visitor experience for recreationists.
text: Rather than encouraging individuals and small business to use our lands, federal bureaucracy and a lack of resources and capacity are making it difficult to provide a quality visitor experience for recreationists.

html: Special recreation permits are taking too long to be processed. For example, in the @ChugachForestAK, a guide who wanted to bring people ice fishing was told there was a moratorium on permit applications&to check back in 7 years. That is unacceptable & unfortunately not uncommon.
text: Special recreation permits are taking too long to be processed. For example, in the @ChugachForestAK, a guide who wanted to bring people ice fishing was told there was a moratorium on permit applications&to check back in 7 years. That is unacceptable & unfortunately not uncommon.

html: I commend the many states who have made legislative efforts to stop the illicit elephant ivory trade. But many state ivory bans have hurt indigenous people who continue their cultural tradition of carvings made from locally found fossilized mammoth ivory or from marine mammals.

html: I continue to have serious concerns about splicing DNA from two animals to produce a new marketable fish, essentially creating a new species. American consumers deserve to know what they purchasing, and ultimately eating.
text: I continue to have serious concerns about splicing DNA from two animals to produce a new marketable fish, essentially creating a new species. American consumers deserve to know what they purchasing, and ultimately eating.

html: I am not going to back down & will continue my fight to ensure that any salmon product that is genetically engineered be clearly labeled. USDA’s new guidelines don’t require adequate mandatory labeling & don’t suffice as giving consumers clear information.
text: I am not going to back down & will continue my fight to ensure that any salmon product that is genetically engineered be clearly labeled. USDA’s new guidelines don’t require adequate mandatory labeling & don’t suffice as giving consumers clear information.

html: The @US_FDA recently deactivated a 2016 import alert that prevented Genetically Engineered (GE) salmon from entering the U.S. market. I’m extremely disappointed in the FDA’s short-sighted decision. It is wrong-headed and a bad idea, simple as that. https://bit.ly/2J1zSEV
text: The @US_FDA recently deactivated a 2016 import alert that prevented Genetically Engineered (GE) salmon from entering the U.S. market. I’m extremely disappointed in the FDA’s short-sighted decision. It is wrong-headed and a bad idea, simple as that. https://bit.ly/2J1zSEV

html: The electricity sector is just 1 piece of the puzzle when it comes to climate change, but it's the most visible & all encompassing. Reliable electric power is central to our way of life, whether its powering our homes and businesses, or cell phones and sometimes our vehicles.
text: The electricity sector is just 1 piece of the puzzle when it comes to climate change, but it's the most visible & all encompassing. Reliable electric power is central to our way of life, whether its powering our homes and businesses, or cell phones and sometimes our vehicles.

html: Funding to construct America’s 1st polar security cutter (icebreaker) in a decade & to begin construction of a 2nd was recently signed into law. While this is good progress, I'll continue to push for investments to strengthen our strategic presence in the Arctic.
text: Funding to construct America’s 1st polar security cutter (icebreaker) in a decade & to begin construction of a 2nd was recently signed into law. While this is good progress, I'll continue to push for investments to strengthen our strategic presence in the Arctic.

html: This @arctic_today article highlights how our only operable heavy polar icebreaker is dealing with a range of technical issues. It’s clear we need a greater investment in icebreakers to protect our waters and national interests in the #Arctic.https://bit.ly/2Vu9THs
text: This @arctic_today article highlights how our only operable heavy polar icebreaker is dealing with a range of technical issues. It’s clear we need a greater investment in icebreakers to protect our waters and national interests in the #Arctic.https://bit.ly/2Vu9THs

html: This legislation is just one step in the effort to clean up our contaminated lands, but by listing PFAS as a hazardous substance the federal government will be able to coordinate response, assist with remediation, and hold responsible parties liable for clean-up costs.
text: This legislation is just one step in the effort to clean up our contaminated lands, but by listing PFAS as a hazardous substance the federal government will be able to coordinate response, assist with remediation, and hold responsible parties liable for clean-up costs.

html: I recently joined a bipartisan effort to declare per- & polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) as hazardous substances. The studies surrounding the effects of PFAS are ongoing, but emerging findings indicate that these compounds are linked to a number of adverse human health effects.pic.twitter.com/E3BIWHlqh3
text: I recently joined a bipartisan effort to declare per- & polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) as hazardous substances. html: For the ERA to be incorporated into the Constitution, we need 38 states to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment. As of now, we have 37. The bill I’m leading, alongside @SenatorCardin will resolve any ambiguity over whether states can make the ERA effective by ratifying it this year.
text: For the ERA to be incorporated into the Constitution, we need 38 states to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment. As of now, we have 37. The bill I’m leading, alongside @SenatorCardin will resolve any ambiguity over whether states can make the ERA effective by ratifying it this year.

html: The Equal Rights Amendment is as important in the fight for women’s equality as it was in 1972, when AK ratified. Women’s equality is fundamental to the American way of life & needs to be expressly recognized in the Constitution.https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1088971552799027200 …

text: I urge each of us to look to the example he set; to consider men & women by the content of their character; to learn from the past & to look forward with hope, supporting one another as we strive to uphold Dr. King’s vision of justice, freedom, & human rights for every American.

html: Today we pay tribute to the life & teachings of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. on what would be his 89th birthday. html: The issues at our border and impasse over our immigration system weaken America but an indefinite government shutdown is equally damaging to our economy, our security and the well-being of the American people. This needs to end now.
text: The issues at our border and impasse over our immigration system weaken America but an indefinite government shutdown is equally damaging to our economy, our security and the well-being of the American people. This needs to end now.

html: It has become clear that negotiations to this point have led us to an impasse. I welcome the President’s decision to put an offer on the table today and will review it in full once details are released. I will encourage my colleagues to do the same.
text: It has become clear that negotiations to this point have led us to an impasse. I welcome the President’s decision to put an offer on the table today and will review it in full once details are released. I will encourage my colleagues to do the same.

html: I am deeply disappointed we have not been able to advance a more positive solution to reopen the government and address border security, but my frustration is nothing compared to these families. We owe it to the people of this country to get this place working again.

html: FEBRUARY SNAP BENEFITS WILL BE DELIVERED EARLY Individuals who use SNAP EBT should keep in mind that February food dollars will be added in the middle of January this year. This means that you may have two months’ worth of food dollars on your account this month.
text:
FEBRUARY SNAP BENEFITS WILL BE DELIVERED EARLY

Individuals who use SNAP EBT should keep in mind that February food dollars will be added in the middle of January this year. This means that you may have two months’ worth of food dollars on your account this month.

html: The recent magnitude 7.0 earthquake was an unsettling experience for many Alaskans. Roads collapsed, homes damaged & several schools will be shut for extended periods. html: Shutting down the government is no way to govern. It is disruptive, harmful, wasteful & could leave hundreds of thousands of federal employees w/out paychecks over Christmas. I’m committed to working w/ my colleagues to end this partial shutdown. https://bit.ly/2V5xkY9

html: I'm encouraged that the Senate Majority Leader and Minority Leader made a public commitment tonight to keep working to find a solution to funding the government and addressing border security in a manner the President will accept. We owe it to the American people to govern.
text: I'm encouraged that the Senate Majority Leader and Minority Leader made a public commitment tonight to keep working to find a solution to funding the government and addressing border security in a manner the President will accept. We owe it to the American people to govern.

html: I’m disappointed we could not reach an agreement tonight. Funding the government is a fundamental part of our responsibility to govern. We all should commit to end this partial shutdown as soon as possible. https://bit.ly/2T2XlFC
text: I’m disappointed we could not reach an agreement tonight. Funding the government is a fundamental part of our responsibility to govern. We all should commit to end this partial shutdown as soon as possible. https://bit.ly/2T2XlFC

html: Our nation has benefited from the viewpoints expressed by General Kelly & General Mattis, both of whom are unfortunately leaving the White House. My advice to the President is that he reconsider the Syrian withdrawal as he gets his new senior military team in place.
text: Our nation has benefited from the viewpoints expressed by General Kelly & General Mattis, both of whom are unfortunately leaving the White House. My advice to the President is that he reconsider the Syrian withdrawal as he gets his new senior military team in place.

html: While I do not support American troops being stationed in Syria indefinitely, I find the administration’s withdrawal troubling and shortsighted. I am equally alarmed by reports of an abrupt reduction in forces from Afghanistan where Alaskans have fought and died.
text: While I do not support American troops being stationed in Syria indefinitely, I find the administration’s withdrawal troubling and shortsighted. I am equally alarmed by reports of an abrupt reduction in forces from Afghanistan where Alaskans have fought and died.

html: Secretary Mattis is a strong, respected leader w/ a wealth of knowledge about the issues & challenges facing our national security. His departure leaves a big hole in the cabinet leadership. I thank Secretary Mattis for his leadership & service to the US. https://bit.ly/2QJIQd7

html: Currently the US has 2 icebreakers. One is permanently in dry dock & she's never going to see activity again. The other one is on her 2nd life down in Antarctica. So here we are, an Arctic nation & we're down to 1 icebreaker. I have likened my proposal to Uber for icebreakers.pic.twitter.com/Fj1acybCYx

html: The importance of access to healthcare cannot be understated, and I am committed to ensuring that all Alaskans have access to affordable, quality healthcare.
text: The importance of access to healthcare cannot be understated, and I am committed to ensuring that all Alaskans have access to affordable, quality healthcare.

html: I want to give Alaskans & all Americans, the certainty they need that protections for those with pre-existing conditions will remain intact, which is why I support legislation to make certain no one loses coverage based on health status.
text: I want to give Alaskans & all Americans, the certainty they need that protections for those with pre-existing conditions will remain intact, which is why I support legislation to make certain no one loses coverage based on health status.

html: In AK healthcare remains a priority & concern. The Texas v. Azar ruling has no immediate impact & I'm confident higher courts will review the decision. Regardless, we must preserve the provisions of the ACA that have benefited so many, like protections for pre-existing conditions

html: Given what happened I find myself thinking, “we were lucky.” Not that we were hit by a major earthquake, but in that it could have been so much worse. Alaskans were prepared—just as you would expect us to be. We are tough, resilient, & will come back from this stronger than ever.
text: Given what happened I find myself thinking, “we were lucky.” Not that we were hit by a major earthquake, but in that it could have been so much worse. Alaskans were prepared—just as you would expect us to be. We are tough, resilient, & will come back from this stronger than ever.

html: .@SenDanSullivan & I flew home this weekend to assess the damage. We have major work ahead to rebuild our roads, schools, ports, & other structures that were damaged. For example, more than 85 schools sustained enough damage that they need time to be cleaned up and repaired.
text: .@SenDanSullivan & I flew home this weekend to assess the damage. We have major work ahead to rebuild our roads, schools, ports, & other structures that were damaged. For example, more than 85 schools sustained enough damage that they need time to be cleaned up and repaired.

html: Early reports came in from 1st responders who had quickly jumped into action, while civil engineers were dispatched to check on highways, bridges, & essential infrastructure like hospitals. We waited to hear reports of serious injuries & fatalities, which fortunately, never came.
text: Early reports came in from 1st responders who had quickly jumped into action, while civil engineers were dispatched to check on highways, bridges, & essential infrastructure like hospitals. We waited to hear reports of serious injuries & fatalities, which fortunately, never came.

html: My staff in AK called saying that pipes had burst in their houses. One of the main roads in Anchorage had parts of it collapse, trapping cars. In schools across Anchorage & Mat-Su Valley, students hid under desks to “duck & cover” as things crashed to the floor around them.
text: My staff in AK called saying that pipes had burst in their houses. One of the main roads in Anchorage had parts of it collapse, trapping cars. In schools across Anchorage & Mat-Su Valley, students hid under desks to “duck & cover” as things crashed to the floor around them.

html: Houston Middle sustained so much structural damage that it’s been deemed unsafe for students to come back to this facility for the rest of the school year. Devastation we saw included cinder blocks coming out of the ceiling, side walls coming apart, exposed steel, and debris.pic.twitter.com/EnFdZROvFu
text: Houston Middle sustained so much structural damage that it’s been deemed unsafe for students to come back to this facility for the rest of the school year. Devastation we saw included cinder blocks coming out of the ceiling, side walls coming apart, exposed steel, and debris.pic.twitter.com/EnFdZROvFu

html: It was gut wrenching to be in Houston Middle School & to imagine what it was like for the students Friday morning when the quake hit. html: Alaskans are incredibly resilient but that doesn’t mean that when you’re hit with something of this intensity it doesn’t have a substantial and devastating impact. The message I want to convey to friends, family, and Alaskans across the state is that we are on top of this.
text: Alaskans are incredibly resilient but that doesn’t mean that when you’re hit with something of this intensity it doesn’t have a substantial and devastating impact. The message I want to convey to friends, family, and Alaskans across the state is that we are on top of this.

html: The impact is very real and will require a great deal of recovery and effort, but I have been assured that Alaskans will have what they need to deal with and recover from this very serious earthquake.
text: The impact is very real and will require a great deal of recovery and effort, but I have been assured that Alaskans will have what they need to deal with and recover from this very serious earthquake.
